content: i slipped up big time yayalovestoknit august 9 2020 i slipped up was originally introduced in 2016 as a child size hat pattern the original pattern featured a plain top but this adult size version continues the slip_stitch pattern all the way to the top of the hat the texture is subtle but the scrunchy fabric adds some interest and is appropriate for either male or female wearer the slip_stitch makes it a quick project while you re knitting enjoy this oldie from when paul simon and art garfunkel were still a duo song of the day simon & garfunkel - slip slidin away https //youtu be/znt5fnmk2sm size the sample hats measure 9 from top to bottom and 19 around the bottom band unstretched there s a lot of ease in this hat so it will easily fit an adult size head yarn the sample hats were knit using 73 grams/160 6 yards of cascade 220 superwash wool in color #856 aporto 100% superwash wool 100 grams/220 yards per skein 1 | pa ge 65 grams/143 yards of universal yarn deluxe worsted superwash in nitrox blue 100% superwash wool 100 grams/220+ yards per skein less yarn was needed for the 2nd sample the universal yarn is thicker than the cascade so it took fewer rounds to knit the body of the hat needles us 06 and 07 circular needles plus us 07 double pointed needles other tools 1 unique stitch marker to indicate the beginning of round bor tapestry/darning needle to finish the top of the hat and optional 7 stitch markers of a different color or design to separate the decrease repeats gauge 22 sts x 36 rnds = 4 square abbreviations used k = knit k2tog = knit two stitches together kw = knitwise p = purl round = round sl slip_stitch st s = stitch es reminder for this pattern all slip stitches are knitwise begin pattern using the us 06 circular needle cast on 96 sts taking care to not twist the stitches place the unique stitch marker to indicate the beginning of round and join to begin knitting in the round knit 3 rounds of stockinette to form the rolled edge if you don t care for the look of a rolled edge please feel free to skip this step bottom band k1 p1 around knit around repeat until band measures between 1-½ to 2 from the bottom edge … your preference the band on the sample hats measures 2 body of hat change to us 07 1 knit 1 round 2 k1 sl1 kw around 2 | pa ge 3 knit around 4 sl1 kw k1 around 5 knit around note all slip stitches are knit wise when you work the all-knit round following the slip stitch round you will experience a bit of resistance when knitting into the slipped stitches from the prior round no worries … that s because those stitches are twisted and that s what creates the texture repeat rnds
